metadata.synopsis: A nurse is tending to the corpse of Arabella's father, one of the rejected/failed experiments of the Surgeon. She is insistent that it makes sense, even though the corpse is well... a corpse. The player can trade with this nurse.
metadata.how_to_trigger: In the hospital in the shadow cursed town, interact with the nurse in the children's ward who is tending a corpse

16.speaker: Sister Lidwin
16.text: I'll do better, and the patients will be better, and it will all be fine...

23.speaker: Sister Lidwin
23.text: The doctor's teachings live on. I will be fine, the patients will be fine, everything fine.

46.speaker: Sister Lidwin
46.text: Don't call the doctor yet! I've got potions, sutures - I know I can do this...
46.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't see you coming, but from the sound of your footsteps thinks you might be the doctor. NodeContext: The nurse is panicking assuming you are a patient

72.speaker: Sister Lidwin
72.text: Oh, you're a patient. This is the children's ward - triage is back that way.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices you. NodeContext: Mid-inspection, the nurse notices the player.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: See that corpse? Arabella's father, in the oh-so-decaying flesh.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: That's Arabella's father - or was Arabella's father.
62.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: That body she's working on - that's Arabella's father.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Why are you treating a dead body?

66.speaker: Sister Lidwin
66.text: Not dead, merely medicated. To ease the pain.
66.context: NodeContext: indignant, but quick to regain professional composure

5.speaker: Player
5.text: The patient's definitely dead. Been dead for a while, judging by the smell.

76.speaker: Sister Lidwin
76.text: The patient is asleep. The sedative is quite strong, you see.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Give the corpse a subtle poke.

17.speaker: Sister Lidwin
17.text: Hey! Don't do that to my patient!
17.context: InternalNodeContext: The nurse reacts to the player giving the corpse a poke.

60.speaker: Sister Lidwin
60.text: I see movement! The patient's awake! Hello, can you hear me?
60.context: InternalNodeContext: The nurse thinks the hand movement is a sign that the patient is waking up (he's not), and addresses him.NodeContext: overjoyed, grateful

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Now that that's sorted, might I purchase some supplies?

83.speaker: Sister Lidwin
83.text: Still not feeling better? Let's see if I can help you.

26.speaker: Sister Lidwin
26.text: Not much left now, but you're welcome to look.

21.speaker: Sister Lidwin
21.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to tend to my patient.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I know this stillness - his body is simply conserving energy as he heals. The patient is stable.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I sense the patient's soul - he is merely resting while his body heals.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I see now - they're sleeping peacefully. I think your work here is already done.

82.speaker: Sister Lidwin
82.text: Yes, yes! I knew these hands would not fail me. The patient is sure to recover.

39.speaker: Sister Lidwin
39.text: Now I must ask you to step away. This patient demands my utmost attention.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Ah, you've induced such a peaceful sleep. Your knowledge of herbs is impressive - the doctor would be proud.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I see you have medical supplies on hand. Can you spare any?

13.speaker: Sister Lidwin
13.text: I will sell you what I can once I've stabilised the patient.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Actually, the doctor requested my presence - I'm a master of natural remedy.

4.speaker: Sister Lidwin
4.text: Most unorthodox. But I am not one to question the doctor's methods... Do you need something of me?

8.speaker: Sister Lidwin
8.text: You must be mistaken - the doctor would have informed us of such an arrangement.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Is that Arabella's father she's tending? Our little idol thief has some terrible luck.
73.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Ugh - I know that corpse. Arabella's father's met a most unpleasant end.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: This corpse... It's Arabella's father. The horror of his end I daren't contemplate.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You recognise the corpse being tended - the girl Arabella's father.*
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: See that corpse? Arabella's mother, in the oh-so-decaying flesh.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: That's Arabella's mother - or was Arabella's mother.
30.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: That body - it looks like Arabella's mother.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Is that Arabella's mother she's tending? Our little idol thief has some terrible luck.
6.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Ugh - I know that corpse. Arabella's mother's met a most unpleasant end.

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: This corpse... It's Arabella's mother. The horror of her end I daren't contemplate.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *You recognise the corpse being tended - the girl Arabella's mother.*
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Must be Arabella's father. What's left of him, anyway.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: A tiefling. That's Arabella's father, I wager - or was Arabella's father.
24.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: That body she's tending must be Arabella's father.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: A tiefling corpse - odds are that's sweet Arabella's father.
14.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: That tiefling's seen better days. Arabella's father, I wager.

64.speaker: Gale
64.text: A dead tiefling. Arabella's father, no doubt. The horror of his end I daren't contemplate.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *The corpse is a tiefling man - the girl Arabella's father, presumably.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: A tiefling. Must be Arabella's mother. What's left of her, anyway.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: A tiefling. That's Arabella's mother, I wager - or was Arabella's mother.
11.context: NodeContext: Referring to a nearby corpse.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: That corpse she's tending must be Arabella's mother.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: A tiefling corpse - odds are that's sweet Arabella's mother.
47.context: NodeContext: Said quietly to the player

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: That tiefling's seen better days. Arabella's mother, I wager.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: A dead tiefling. Arabella's mother, no doubt. The horror of her end I daren't contemplate.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *The corpse is a tiefling woman - the girl Arabella's mother, presumably.*
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Her patient is a tiefling - one you don't recognise, though clearly long dead.*
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: (It is OK not to show the corpse, and only player face here)

77.speaker: Sister Lidwin
77.text: The doctor's found oblivion... well. No time to mourn. I'll fix this without him.
